docs.lead_paragraph: The passengers of the Sardinian frigate Des Geneys were landed on the 9th inst., at Staten Island, and are now in our City. They are represented by the Health Officer at Quarantine, as being, according to the most reliable information he could obtain,

docs.lead_paragraph: Mortality in Brooklyn. The Health Officer reports 74 deaths as having occurred during the week ending March 10, from the following DISEASES.--Constipation, dropsy in the chest drowned, dysentery, fever puerperal, typhoid fever, typhus fever, hooping cough, inflammation of the bowels, jaundice, old age, scrofula, one each. estion

headline.main: THE POOLE MURDER.; Flight of Baker for the Canary Islands. His Departure in the Brig Isabella Jewett. SEIZURE OF LETTERS LEFT BY THE CULPRIT Action of the Authorities to Pursue the Vessel. A Steamer Offered Gratuitously by George Law. A COUNCILMAN IN THE TOMBS. ARREST OF THE ACCESSORIES. Continuation of the Coroner's Investigation.

docs.lead_paragraph: The intelligence published exclusively in the DAILY TIMES of yesterday, concerning the diligent pursuit by Judge STUART and a posse of the police for the capture of LOUIS BAKER, produced intense excitement in the City. The news spread with great rapidity, and Jersey City, to which place BARER was traced, was alive with excitement.

headline.main: LATER FROM CALIFORNIA.; ARRIVAL OF THE ILLINOIS. $1,161,248 IN SPECIE. From the Pacific Coast of South America. ITEMS FROM AUSTRALIA. LATER FROM THE SANDWICH ISLANDS. Negotiations for Annexation Discontinued by Order of the King.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Illinois, mail steamer from Aspinwall on the 2d inst., arrived at this port last night. To Purser E. H. HULL, and to ADAMS CO.'S Express, we are indebted for California files, memoranda, a few Panama papers, and an Acapulco Bulletin.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; THE AFRICAN SLAVE-TRADE. Discharge of Bartholomew Blanco--Opinion of U. S. Commissioner Motron. Fires Yesterday. Marine Accidents. City Mortality.

docs.lead_paragraph: On Saturday last U.S. Commissioner Morton, before whom the case of BARTHOLOMEW BLANCO, who was arrested on a charge of fitting out the bark Millenden for the African Slave-Trade, was tried rendered the subjoined decision discharging the prisoner:

headline.main: THE DEATH OF WM. POOLE.; ARREST OF MORRISSEY AS AN ACCOMPLICE, COMMITMENT OF JOHN HYLER. Reward offered for the Arrest of Baker. THE CORONE'S INVESTIGATION.

docs.lead_paragraph: Prior to resuming the investigation into the facts connected with the death of WILLIAM POOLE, yesterday morning. JOHN HYLER, who is alleged to be an accompliee in the homicide, was brought before Coroner HILTON and committed. The investigation was held in the chamber of he Board of Aldermen. There was a large number of persons in attendance.

headline.main: QUARANTINE.; Shall Quarantine be Removed to Sandy Hook?

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New. York Daily Times: The necessity and importance of a Quarantine establishment for this port, were long since determined on as the settled policy of our own State,--a policy which New-Jersey should cherish equally with us ; for is not New-York Bay, for every purpose of convenience and utility, a joint property?

headline.main: THE PROHIBITORY LAW.; Testimony in Favor of its Operation in Other States.

docs.lead_paragraph: E. C. DELAVAN, Esq., has handed to Senator WILLIAMS, Chairman of the Select Committee on the Temperance Cause in the State Senate, the following letters which he has received in regard to the practical operation of the Prohibitory Law in other States: LETTER FROM HON. SAMUEL A. FOOTE, OF GENEVA.

headline.main: A Word to Sam in his Family.

docs.lead_paragraph: The delightful weather we have enjoyed for a week past ought to have tempted the most delicate of our feeble folk out on walks of pleasure or business. The streets have been in good condition for pedestrians, though bad enough for carriages; the sidewalks free and dry, and the crossings, except. near the rivers, commendably clean.
